de.feig.FEDM.Core

Interface IFwUpdListener


  • public interface IFwUpdListener
    Listener interface for application classes, handling firmware update events. Description:
    Class for providing a listener interface for application classes, handling firmware update events

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void onNewFwUpdMessage(int msgMode, int errorCode, int progressCounter, int counterLimit, java.lang.String message)
      Is called, when a new update related message is available

    • Method Detail

      • onNewFwUpdMessage

        void onNewFwUpdMessage(int msgMode,
                       int errorCode,
                       int progressCounter,
                       int counterLimit,
                       java.lang.String message)
        Is called, when a new update related message is available
        Parameters:
        msgMode - message mode to control the content of the method parameters
        errorCode - error code. See error code
        progressCounter - progress counter, started by zero
        counterLimit - limit of progress counter
        message - message text Description
        This listener method sends status information of the currently running firmware update process.
        The message can contain different content and is controlled by the parameter msgMode:
        0 - signals only message text - Example: onNewFwUpdMessage(0, 0, 0, 0, "message text")
        1 - signals progress counter (3), progress range (510) and message text - Example: onNewFwUpdMessage(1, 0, 3, 510, "message text")
        2 - signals new limit of progress range (set to new value); no message text - Example: onNewFwUpdMessage(2, 0, 0, 510, NULL)
        3 - signals end of update; no message text - Example: onNewFwUpdMessage(3, 0, 0, 0, NULL)
        4 - signals error code and message text. After this notification, the update process is canceled. - Example: onNewFwUpdMessage(4, error code, 0, 0, "error text")
